title: TypeError when using SparseAdam + GPU
body_html:
• PyTorch 0.3.1
  • OS: ubuntu 16.04
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
  • Python version: 3.6.4
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.0

When I try to run my script (you can clone the repo and directly run the script), using SparseAdam (see in line82) with GPU:
python3 word2vec.py --train ../../data/de.sent.1e4 --cuda

I got the error:

File "word2vec.py", line 158, in
train(w2v)
File "word2vec.py", line 96, in train
total_loss += train_batch(w2v, optimizer, pairs[:w2v.bs], w2v.bs, neg_idxs)
File "word2vec.py", line 151, in train_batch
optimizer.step()
File "/home/yz568/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/optim/sparse_adam.py", line 93, in step
p.data.add_(make_sparse(-step_size * numer.div_(denom)))
File "/home/yz568/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/optim/sparse_adam.py", line 69, in make_sparse
return constructor(grad_indices, values, size)
TypeError: torch.cuda.sparse.FloatTensor constructor received an invalid combination of arguments - got (torch.cuda.LongTensor, torch.FloatTensor, torch.Size), but expected one of:
no arguments
(int size)
(torch.Size sizes)
(torch.cuda.LongTensor indices, torch.cuda.FloatTensor values)
(torch.cuda.LongTensor indices, torch.cuda.FloatTensor values, torch.Size sizes)
didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (torch.cuda.LongTensor, torch.FloatTensor, torch.Size)
(int ...)
didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (torch.cuda.LongTensor, torch.FloatTensor, torch.Size)

But it works well when running with

  1. SpaseAdam + CPU
  2. SGD + CPU
  3. SGD + GPU

body:
- PyTorch 0.3.1
- OS: ubuntu 16.04
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
- Python version: 3.6.4
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.0

When I try to run my [script](https://github.com/zhu-y11/my_wordembs/blob/master/word2vec/pytorch/word2vec.py) (you can clone the repo and directly run the script), using SparseAdam (see in line82) with GPU:
`python3 word2vec.py --train ../../data/de.sent.1e4 --cuda`

I got the error:

> File "word2vec.py", line 158, in <module>
    train(w2v)
  File "word2vec.py", line 96, in train
    total_loss += train_batch(w2v, optimizer, pairs[:w2v.bs], w2v.bs, neg_idxs)
  File "word2vec.py", line 151, in train_batch
    optimizer.step()
  File "/home/yz568/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/optim/sparse_adam.py", line 93, in step
    p.data.add_(make_sparse(-step_size * numer.div_(denom)))
  File "/home/yz568/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/optim/sparse_adam.py", line 69, in make_sparse
    return constructor(grad_indices, values, size)
TypeError: torch.cuda.sparse.FloatTensor constructor received an invalid combination of arguments - got (torch.cuda.LongTensor, torch.FloatTensor, torch.Size), but expected one of:
 no arguments
 (int size)
 (torch.Size sizes)
 (torch.cuda.LongTensor indices, torch.cuda.FloatTensor values)
 (torch.cuda.LongTensor indices, torch.cuda.FloatTensor values, torch.Size sizes)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (torch.cuda.LongTensor, torch.FloatTensor, torch.Size)
 (int ...)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (torch.cuda.LongTensor, torch.FloatTensor, torch.Size)

But it works well when running with
1. SpaseAdam + CPU
2. SGD + CPU
3. SGD + GPU
